Brown was born as '''Louis Brownstein''' in [[Odessa]], [[Russian Empire]]. His family emigrated to the United States in 1898 and settled in [[The Bronx]] of [[New York City]]. Brown wrote lyrics for many of the top [[Tin Pan Alley]] [[songwriter]]s of the day, including [[Albert Von Tilzer]], [[Con Conrad]], and [[Harold Arlen]]. He was one third of a successful songwriting and music publishing team with [[Ray Henderson]] and [[Buddy De Sylva]] from 1925 until 1929. Brown also wrote or co-wrote several [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] shows.
